page.title: 16COVEN OUTDOOR CENTRE
page.content: This outdoor education centre is run by the Staffordshire County Council for the use of schools in the county,but due to popular demand the facilities are now available for use by organised groups at the warden's discretion.It is a very popular venue for local scout and guide troops.The centre extends over 24 acres,about half of which is woodland with ponds.The Staffordshire and Worcestershire canal forms one of the boundaries.The site lends itself to a very wide variety of activities including pioneering,backwoods cooking, map and compass work,canoeing,plaster- casting and tracking,etc.The assault course is always popular with the boys. Most groups camp out but dormitory facilities are available, with toilets, showers,hot water and a kitchen.
